You are given $n$ points on a plane, where $n$ is between 3 and 5000.  The area of any triangle formed by three of these points is less than or equal to $S$, where $S$ is between 1 and 10<sup>18</sup>.

Find three points (which may or may not be the given points) that form a triangle containing all $n$ points, and whose area is less than or equal to $4S$.

Print the coordinates of these three points, one per line.  Each coordinate should be an integer between -10<sup>8</sup> and 10<sup>8</sup>.
You are given a set of points on a plane.  Find three points that form a triangle containing all the given points, and the area of this triangle is no larger than four times a given maximum area.
